org.nzdis.micro.util

Class StackTracePrinter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.nzdis.micro.util.StackTracePrinter

  • public class StackTracePrinter
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      StackTracePrinter() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static java.lang.StackTraceElement getCaller()
      Returns caller of method calling the code that calls this method.
      static java.lang.String getStackTrace()
      Returns the StackTrace as String but cutting off the first three entries to derive the caller and the remaining trace.
      static java.lang.String getStackTrace(int numberOfLinesToOmit)
      Returns the StackTrace at the point it is called but omits a specified number of entries.
      static void printFullStackTrace()
      Prints the full stack trace on the position where this method is called.
      static void printStackTrace()
      Prints current stack trace but cuts off first three entries (which mostly refer to this method itself).
      static void printStackTrace(int numberOfLinesToOmit)
      Prints current stack trace but cuts off first number of lines as specified in parameter.

      • printStackTrace

        public static void printStackTrace()
        Prints current stack trace but cuts off first three entries (which mostly refer to this method itself).

      • printStackTrace

        public static void printStackTrace(int numberOfLinesToOmit)
        Prints current stack trace but cuts off first number of lines as specified in parameter.
        Parameters:
        numberOfLinesToOmit - Number of lines to be cut off

      • getStackTrace

        public static java.lang.String getStackTrace(int numberOfLinesToOmit)
        Returns the StackTrace at the point it is called but omits a specified number of entries. Pass 0 (zero) to receive full trace.
        Parameters:
        numberOfLinesToOmit - Number of entries to be omitted
        Returns:
        String containing StackTrace

      • getStackTrace

        public static java.lang.String getStackTrace()
        Returns the StackTrace as String but cutting off the first three entries to derive the caller and the remaining trace.
        Returns:
        String containing StackTrace

      • printFullStackTrace

        public static void printFullStackTrace()
        Prints the full stack trace on the position where this method is called.

      • getCaller

        public static java.lang.StackTraceElement getCaller()
        Returns caller of method calling the code that calls this method. Confusing, isn't it ;)
        Returns:
